title: Define Project Requirements - Updated
description: Thoroughly revise and update the detailed requirements for the BioDataPipeline project, including data types (e.g., genomic, imaging), sources, security needs (e.g., encryption methods such as AES-256 and RSA, access controls, multi-factor authentication, data anonymization methods like k-anonymity or l-diversity), performance requirements (latency, throughput, scalability), user workflows, integration with existing systems (API documentation needed, including Swagger for REST APIs and Postman for interactive testing), scalability considerations (horizontal and vertical scaling strategies, auto-scaling mechanisms like AWS Auto Scaling Groups), compliance with relevant regulations (HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA), data retention policies, disaster recovery plans, and detailed design for the overall system architecture (including microservices architecture, containerization using Docker and Kubernetes, orchestration with Kubernetes, and service meshes like Istio for communication between services). The revised document should also address testing strategies (unit testing, integration testing, performance testing), deployment strategies (continuous integration/continuous deployment with tools like Jenkins, Docker, and Kubernetes), maintenance strategies (monitoring using Prometheus and alerting using Alertmanager), and documentation strategies (using Markdown or Doxygen for code comments, and Sphinx for generating project documentation). The revised document should also provide a timeline for the completion of each requirement. If necessary, break down the task into smaller subtasks and assign them to appropriate team members. The final document will be reviewed by the security specialist, technical writer, and project manager.

title: Design Data Ingestion Pipeline
description: Design a secure and efficient pipeline for transferring life sciences data from various sources to the cloud storage.

title: Implement Cloud Storage
description: Set up and configure a cloud-based storage solution for securely storing and managing the life sciences data.

title: Develop Data Access API
description: Design and implement a secure API for accessing and querying the life sciences data stored in the cloud.

title: Build User Interface
description: Develop a user-friendly web interface for interacting with the BioDataPipeline, including data upload, search, and visualization.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure data privacy and security by implementing appropriate access controls, encryption, and auditing mechanisms.

title: Set up CI/CD Pipeline
description: Establish a continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the BioDataPipeline.

title: Conduct Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans to ensure the BioDataPipeline meets all functional, performance, and security requirements.

title: Write Documentation
description: Create user guides, technical documentation, and training materials for the BioDataPipeline.

title: Deploy to Production
description: Deploy the BioDataPipeline to a production environment and monitor its performance and usage.
